org.apache.flink.streaming.api.invokable

Class StreamInvokable<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.invokable.StreamInvokable<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    OUT - The output type of the invokable
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchGroupReduceInvokable, BatchReduceInvokable, CoInvokable, CounterInvokable, FilterInvokable, FlatMapInvokable, MapInvokable, ProjectInvokable, SinkInvokable, SourceInvokable, StreamReduceInvokable

    public abstract class StreamInvokable<IN,OUT>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The StreamInvokable represents the base class for all invokables in the streaming topology.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Collector<OUT> collector,
                       MutableObjectIterator<StreamRecord<IN>> recordIterator,
                       StreamRecordSerializer<IN> serializer,
                       boolean isMutable)
        Initializes the StreamInvokable for input and output handling
        Parameters:
        collector - Collector object for collecting the outputs for the operator
        recordIterator - Iterator for reading in the input records
        serializer - Serializer used to deserialize inputs
        isMutable - Mutability setting for the operator

      • resetReuse

        protected void resetReuse()
        Re-initializes the object in which the next input record will be read in

      • invoke

        public void invoke()
            throws Exception
        Method that will be called when the stream starts. The user should encode the processing functionality in mutableInvoke() and immutableInvoke()
        Throws:
        Exception

        public void open(Configuration parameters)
          throws Exception
        Open method to be used if the user defined function extends the RichFunction class
        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration parameters for the operator
        Throws:
        Exception
